name: Coconut Tilapia with Apricot Dipping Sauce
author: Diane Horn Talts
summary: After having coconut shrimp at a famous restaurant here in Phoenix, I decided to recreate it at home using a mild white fish filet and tilapia was my first choice.  Sit back and enjoy the compliments.
directions: Toss together the coconut, flour and Creole seasoning in a bowl
In a separate bowl, toss the tilapia with the cornstarch, and shake off the excess
Pour the egg substitute into a separate bowl, and dip the fillets in the egg
Press fillets in the coconut mixture coating all sides
Heat canola oil in a frying pan to a temperature of about 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Fry fillets one or two at a time on both sides until golden brown
Remove to drain on a paper towel
Prepare the apricot dipping sauce by stirring together the jam, mustard, and horseradish in a small bowl
Serve the tilapia accompanied by the dipping sauce
